channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Discrete Semantic Tokenization for Deep CTR Prediction
item.description: The content-encoding paradigm, which integrates user and item encoders directly into CTR models, prioritizes space over time.

item.title: A Causal Inspired Early-Branching Structure for Domain Generalization
item.description: By d-separation, we observe that the causal feature can be further characterized by being independent of the domain conditioned on the object, and we propose the following two strategies as complements for the basic framework.

item.title: HOLMES: HOLonym-MEronym based Semantic inspection for Convolutional Image Classifiers
item.description: Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) are nowadays the model of choice in Computer Vision, thanks to their ability to automatize the feature extraction process in visual tasks.

item.title: Consistent Prompting for Rehearsal-Free Continual Learning
item.description: Specifically, all existing classifiers are exposed to prompt training, resulting in classifier consistency learning.

item.title: HAIFIT: Human-Centered AI for Fashion Image Translation
item.description: Our method excels in preserving the distinctive style and intricate details essential for fashion design applications.

item.title: Rethinking Loss Functions for Fact Verification
item.description: We explore loss functions for fact verification in the FEVER shared task.

item.title: NLQxform-UI: A Natural Language Interface for Querying DBLP Interactively
item.description: In recent years, the DBLP computer science bibliography has been prominently used for searching scholarly information, such as publications, scholars, and venues.

item.title: Follow-Your-Click: Open-domain Regional Image Animation via Short Prompts
item.description: Despite recent advances in image-to-video generation, better controllability and local animation are less explored.

item.title: Fast Inference of Removal-Based Node Influence
item.description: We propose a new method of evaluating node influence, which measures the prediction change of a trained GNN model caused by removing a node.

item.title: iCONTRA: Toward Thematic Collection Design Via Interactive Concept Transfer
item.description: With a user-friendly interface, iCONTRA enables both experienced designers and novices to effortlessly explore creative design concepts and efficiently generate thematic collections.

item.title: Multiscale Low-Frequency Memory Network for Improved Feature Extraction in Convolutional Neural Networks
item.description: Responding to these complexities, we introduce a novel framework, the Multiscale Low-Frequency Memory (MLFM) Network, with the goal to harness the full potential of CNNs while keeping their complexity unchanged.

item.title: MIM4D: Masked Modeling with Multi-View Video for Autonomous Driving Representation Learning
item.description: Learning robust and scalable visual representations from massive multi-view video data remains a challenge in computer vision and autonomous driving.

item.title: From Weak to Strong Sound Event Labels using Adaptive Change-Point Detection and Active Learning
item.description: In this work we propose an audio recording segmentation method based on an adaptive change point detection (A-CPD) for machine guided weak label annotation of audio recording segments.

item.title: PaddingFlow: Improving Normalizing Flows with Padding-Dimensional Noise
item.description: However, Flow-based models suffer two issues, which are manifold and discrete data.

item.title: Local Binary and Multiclass SVMs Trained on a Quantum Annealer
item.description: In the last years, with the advent of working quantum annealers, hybrid SVM models characterised by quantum training and classical execution have been introduced.

item.title: DAM: Dynamic Adapter Merging for Continual Video QA Learning
item.description: Our DAM model outperforms prior state-of-the-art continual learning approaches by 9. 1% while exhibiting 1. 9% less forgetting on 6 VidQA datasets spanning various domains.

item.title: Autoregressive Score Generation for Multi-trait Essay Scoring
item.description: Recently, encoder-only pre-trained models such as BERT have been successfully applied in automated essay scoring (AES) to predict a single overall score.

item.title: Unleashing the Power of Meta-tuning for Few-shot Generalization Through Sparse Interpolated Experts
item.description: Conventional wisdom suggests parameter-efficient fine-tuning of foundation models as the state-of-the-art method for transfer learning in vision, replacing the rich literature of alternatives such as meta-learning.

item.title: Iterative Learning for Joint Image Denoising and Motion Artifact Correction of 3D Brain MRI
item.description: To address these issues, we propose a Joint image Denoising and motion Artifact Correction (JDAC) framework via iterative learning to handle noisy MRIs with motion artifacts, consisting of an adaptive denoising model and an anti-artifact model.

item.title: MoleculeQA: A Dataset to Evaluate Factual Accuracy in Molecular Comprehension
item.description: Large language models are playing an increasingly significant role in molecular research, yet existing models often generate erroneous information, posing challenges to accurate molecular comprehension.

item.title: Tackling the Singularities at the Endpoints of Time Intervals in Diffusion Models
item.description: Most diffusion models assume that the reverse process adheres to a Gaussian distribution.

item.title: Ambient Diffusion Posterior Sampling: Solving Inverse Problems with Diffusion Models trained on Corrupted Data
item.description: We open-source our code and the trained Ambient Diffusion MRI models: https://github. com/utcsilab/ambient-diffusion-mri .

item.title: ViT-CoMer: Vision Transformer with Convolutional Multi-scale Feature Interaction for Dense Predictions
item.description: Compared to the stateof-the-art, ViT-CoMer has the following advantages: (1) We inject spatial pyramid multi-receptive field convolutional features into the ViT architecture, which effectively alleviates the problems of limited local information interaction and single-feature representation in ViT.

item.title: LAFS: Landmark-based Facial Self-supervised Learning for Face Recognition
item.description: This enables our method - namely LAndmark-based Facial Self-supervised learning LAFS), to learn key representation that is more critical for face recognition.

item.title: Can Large Language Models Identify Authorship?
item.description: (3) How can LLMs provide explainability in authorship analysis, particularly through the role of linguistic features?

item.title: Scattered Mixture-of-Experts Implementation
item.description: We present ScatterMoE, an implementation of Sparse Mixture-of-Experts (SMoE) on GPUs.

item.title: A Decade's Battle on Dataset Bias: Are We There Yet?
item.description: We revisit the "dataset classification" experiment suggested by Torralba and Efros a decade ago, in the new era with large-scale, diverse, and hopefully less biased datasets as well as more capable neural network architectures.

item.title: Masked Generative Story Transformer with Character Guidance and Caption Augmentation
item.description: Story Visualization (SV) is a challenging generative vision task, that requires both visual quality and consistency between different frames in generated image sequences.

item.title: ILCiteR: Evidence-grounded Interpretable Local Citation Recommendation
item.description: We contribute a novel dataset for the evidence-grounded local citation recommendation task and demonstrate the efficacy of our proposed conditional neural rank-ensembling approach for re-ranking evidence spans.

item.title: Point Cloud Compression via Constrained Optimal Transport
item.description: This paper presents a novel point cloud compression method COT-PCC by formulating the task as a constrained optimal transport (COT) problem.

item.title: Mean-Field Microcanonical Gradient Descent
item.description: Microcanonical gradient descent is a sampling procedure for energy-based models allowing for efficient sampling of distributions in high dimension.

item.title: SM4Depth: Seamless Monocular Metric Depth Estimation across Multiple Cameras and Scenes by One Model
item.description: Third, to reduce the reliance on massive training data, we propose a ``divide and conquer" solution.

item.title: Large Language Models are Contrastive Reasoners
item.description: Prompting methods play a crucial role in enhancing the capabilities of pre-trained large language models (LLMs).

item.title: Machine Learning Optimized Orthogonal Basis Piecewise Polynomial Approximation
item.description: We show that, using this regularization approach, Chebyshev basis performs better than power basis for all relevant optimizers in the combined approximation and continuity optimization setting and demonstrate usability of the presented approach within the electronic cam domain.

item.title: Language models scale reliably with over-training and on downstream tasks
item.description: We fit scaling laws that extrapolate in both the number of model parameters and the ratio of training tokens to parameters.

item.title: CleanAgent: Automating Data Standardization with LLM-based Agents
item.description: Data standardization is a crucial part in data science life cycle.

item.title: Learning to Describe for Predicting Zero-shot Drug-Drug Interactions
item.description: Adverse drug-drug interactions~(DDIs) can compromise the effectiveness of concurrent drug administration, posing a significant challenge in healthcare.

item.title: LLM-Assisted Light: Leveraging Large Language Model Capabilities for Human-Mimetic Traffic Signal Control in Complex Urban Environments
item.description: Specifically, a hybrid framework that augments LLMs with a suite of perception and decision-making tools is proposed, facilitating the interrogation of both the static and dynamic traffic information.

item.title: SOTOPIA-$π$: Interactive Learning of Socially Intelligent Language Agents
item.description: Motivated by this gap, we propose an interactive learning method, SOTOPIA-$\pi$, improving the social intelligence of language agents.

item.title: Mitigate Target-level Insensitivity of Infrared Small Target Detection via Posterior Distribution Modeling
item.description: Infrared Small Target Detection (IRSTD) aims to segment small targets from infrared clutter background.

item.title: SMART: Submodular Data Mixture Strategy for Instruction Tuning
item.description: Instruction Tuning involves finetuning a language model on a collection of instruction-formatted datasets in order to enhance the generalizability of the model to unseen tasks.

item.title: MonoOcc: Digging into Monocular Semantic Occupancy Prediction
item.description: However, existing methods rely on a complex cascaded framework with relatively limited information to restore 3D scenes, including a dependency on supervision solely on the whole network's output, single-frame input, and the utilization of a small backbone.

item.title: METER: a mobile vision transformer architecture for monocular depth estimation
item.description: State of the art MDE models typically rely on vision transformers (ViT) architectures that are highly deep and complex, making them unsuitable for fast inference on devices with hardware constraints.

item.title: COSTREAM: Learned Cost Models for Operator Placement in Edge-Cloud Environments
item.description: In this work, we present COSTREAM, a novel learned cost model for Distributed Stream Processing Systems that provides accurate predictions of the execution costs of a streaming query in an edge-cloud environment.

item.title: SpeechColab Leaderboard: An Open-Source Platform for Automatic Speech Recognition Evaluation
item.description: In this paper we introduce the SpeechColab Leaderboard, a general-purpose, open-source platform designed for ASR evaluation.

item.title: CoIN: A Benchmark of Continual Instruction tuNing for Multimodel Large Language Model
item.description: To this end, we introduce MoELoRA to MLLMs which is effective to retain the previous instruction alignment.

item.title: Unified Source-Free Domain Adaptation
item.description: To tackle this unified SFDA problem, we propose a novel approach called Latent Causal Factors Discovery (LCFD).

item.title: Ensembling Prioritized Hybrid Policies for Multi-agent Pathfinding
item.description: We first propose a selective communication block to gather richer information for better agent coordination within multi-agent environments and train the model with a Q-learning-based algorithm.

item.title: Authorship Style Transfer with Policy Optimization
item.description: Authorship style transfer aims to rewrite a given text into a specified target while preserving the original meaning in the source.

item.title: Masked AutoDecoder is Effective Multi-Task Vision Generalist
item.description: Inspired by the success of general-purpose models in NLP, recent studies attempt to unify different vision tasks in the same sequence format and employ autoregressive Transformers for sequence prediction.
